intro: Dortmanna heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its ability to produce leaves of varying shapes and sizes, which is a notable botanical feature. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually elongated and have a distinct midrib, which helps in identifying the species. Dortmanna heterophylla is widely distributed across temperate regions and is often found in small, dense clusters.
